description.narrative:
Organisationen för Amerikanska Staters särskilda fredsmission i Colombia (engelska akronym MAPP/OAS) har inkommit med ett förslag till den Svenska Ambassaden i Bogota om finansiering för 30 MSEK till stöd för implementering av fredsmissionens aktiviteter, i linje med deras strategiska Note 2016–2021, under perioden 1 juli 2019 – 21 december 2021.
Insatsens övergripande mål är att stödja den colombianska statens fredspolitik genom omfattade uppföljning, medföljning och stöd till de specifika aktiviteter inom de tematiska områden med syfte att bistå med rekommendationer som bidrar till konsolideringen av en långvarig fred, i linje med mandatet som avtalats mellan Organisationen för Amerikanska Stater och colombianska regering. Aktiviteter är fokuserade på tre huvudområden: fredsbyggande; säkerhetsförhållanden och territoriell dynamik; och övergångsrättvisa och avväpning, demobilisering och återintegrering (DDR).

The Organization of American States Mission to Support the Peace Process in Colombia (MAPP/OAS) has submitted a proposal to the Embassy of Sweden in Bogotá for funding of 30 MSEK to support the implementation of activities of the Mission in line with its Strategic Note 2016-2021, during the period July 1, 2019 - December 31, 2021.
The main objective of the intervention is to support the Colombia State's peace policy through a comprehensive monitoring, accompaniment and support to specific activities within the thematic areas, with the aim of providing recommendations that contribute to the consolidation of a long-lasting peace, in line with the mandate agreed between the Organization of American States and the Colombian government. The activities are focused in three main areas: Peacebuilding; security conditions and territorial dynamics; and transitional justice and disarmament, demobilization and reintegration (DDR).

The main objective of the Mission to support the Peace Process of the Organization of American States (MAPP/OAS) is to support the Colombian State’s peace policy to contribute to the consolidation of a long-lasting peace. This will be achieved through specific results planned in the three main thematic areas: 1) Peacebuilding 2) Security conditions and territorial dynamics 3)Transitional Justice and disarmament, demobilization and reintegration (DDR) The activities within these areas are implemented through a comprehensive monitoring, accompaniment, and support, by the 18 regional offices in the country and the central office in Bogotá.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

title.narrative: Decision on contribution on Support to MAPP/OAS Colombia

description.narrative: This conclusion on performance covers the period from June 1, 2019 to December 31, 2020, since the Swedish support to MAPP/OAS' Basket Fund started on June 1, 2019, and the reports are submitted on an annual basis. During this period two new regional offices were established by MAPP/OAS in the cities of Caucasia (Antioquia department) and Ocaña (Norte de Santander) for a total of 18 regional offices. This contributed to increase their monitoring and accompaniment role, as these regions show high conflictivities in terms of illicit crops, presence of illegal armed groups, high risks for social leaders and human rights defenders. 2,966 field missions were held in 2019, and activities were implemented in 21 departments of the country, 189 municipalities and 942 urban centres. The covid-19 pandemic and the lockdown in Colombia since the end of March 2020 implied an adjustment of MAPP/OAS' monitoring and accompaniment activities which had to be done virtually. During the first semester of 2020, 495 field missions were held in 18 departments, 159 municipalities and 404 urban centres. During the second semester, 3,561 monitoring activities were done virtually in 16 departments, 154 municipalities and 257 urban centres. During 2020, MAPP/OAS made a revision of their planning process focusing on a more strategic process to show how each aerea contributes to the implementation of the Mission's Strategic Objective. As a result, the Process Management Approach was introduced as a complement to the Results Management Approach, and is shown in the annual work plan for 2021. This adjustment in 2020 led to a reduced presentation of the initial 180 objectives and 230 indicators approved for 2020, focusing on those that contribute to the strategic objective of the Mission. MAPP/OAS' added value is their presence in the regions highly affected by the internal armed conflict. They have the confidence of the communities and of the local and national governmental entities. The pandemic and lock down implied a big challenge in this confidence-building process and in implementing their accompaniment and monitoring role. Nevertheless, innovative solutions were found through virtual support and the use of local community radios with specific programs to continue being close to the communities. Some exampless of key results achieved during 2019 and 2020 are shown below within the main three areas identified by MAPPOAS: 1) Peacebuilding MAPP/OAS contributed to strengthen the capacity of the entities responsible of implementing the land restitution policy through accompaniment and providing information on the advances, challenges and difficulties in its implementation. They also contributed with recommendations on how to deal and overcome the problems faced, highlighting always an emphasis on victims' rights. Information on the situation of the territories was submitted to the national government through four reports during this period to reduce the communication gaps between the central government and the territories and to improve the implementation of the local territorial development plans - PDETs. This strengthens the capacity of governmental entities and the decision making spaces with a role within the PDETs, such as the National Territorial Agency (ART - Agencia de Renovación del Territorio). The dialogue- consensus building and conflict management capacity of the civil society and the governmental entities in the departments of Nariño, Casanare, Putumayo, Norte de Santander and Cauca were strengthened through capacity building on social dialogue and virtual accompaniment in different workshops. This contributes to strengthen the confidence between civil society and governmental entities in peacebuilding. 2) Security conditions and territorial dynamics The following documents were produced by MAPP/OAS and submitted to key governmental entities to provide them with accurate and strategic information, analysis and recommendations on issues dealing with: presence and dynamics of illegal armed groups; strategies to reduce illicit crops; security situation of former FARC combatants, their families, journalists and persons with special protection measures; and social conflictivity: 38 documents on the security conditions of the territories where MAPP/OAS is present; 22 documents on strategies to reduce illicit crops in these regions ; 20 documents on the situation in the boarders; and 10 documents on the scenarios of social conflictivity. Virtual meetings contributed to increase the number of dialogue spaces with the communities, the governmental entities and the international community, providing them with information on the local contexts and the results of their monitoring activities. This contributed to improve the information received and the decision making capacity of the different actors. 3)Transitional Justice and disarmament, demobilization and reintegration (DDR) 37 recommendations were submitted to relevant governmental entities with strategies and legal instruments which aim to improve the judicial response to illegal actions with a high social, political and environmental impact. These recommendations contribute to improve the decision making capacity of the institutions on issues dealing with violence against former combatants, social leaders and negative effects to the environment. The coordination and dialogue spaces between the judicial branch, ethnic authorities and the national government were strengthened through accompaniment, implementation of new dialogue spaces and support to the already established spaces contributing to establish mechanisms for a better harmonizaton among the different jurisdictions. Victims' participation within the Transitional Justice system and the Special Jurisdiction for Peace (JEP) was strengthened through the elaboration of a manual for their participation, and through support to their organizations for the elaboration of reports to be submitted to the JEP. 38 specific recommendations were submitted to the different sections of the JEP on the macro cases, protection measures, victims' security and the security of the persons being heard (comparecientes).
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
